intro: Arrowsmithia styphelioides, commonly known as the golden star bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, while its inflorescences consist of clustered, star-shaped blooms. Arrowsmithia styphelioides is well adapted to sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
